summary: The College Admissions Accountability Act of 2025 establishes an Office of the Special Inspector General for Unlawful Discrimination in Higher Education within the Department of Education. This office will investigate complaints of race-based discrimination in college admissions, financial aid, and academic programs, as per the Supreme Court ruling in Students for Fair Admissions, Inc. v. Harvard. The Inspector General will have the power to make recommendations for corrective actions, including potential loss of federal funding, and will report to Congress quarterly. The bill also amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prohibit institutions found to be discriminating based on race from receiving federal funds. The office sunsets 12 years after enactment.
